thread.title: U.S. Dollar Rises as Europe, Emerging Markets Raise Concerns About Growth

author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Rises as Europe, Emerging Markets Raise Concerns About Growth
text:
The U.S. dollar rose Wednesday as investors sought safe assets after a report showed European growth is slowing.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, rose 0.1% to 87.30. The dollar rose 0.7% against the 19-nation currency to $1.1699. The Japanese yen, which also serves as a haven, rose 0.7% against the dollar to Â¥110.08.
